name: BRCA1
description: A human tumor suppressor gene involved in DNA repair.
fact: Mutations in BRCA1 increase risk for breast and ovarian cancer.

name: TP53
description: Encodes p53, a protein that regulates the cell cycle and prevents genome mutation.
fact: TP53 is one of the most commonly mutated genes in human cancers.

name: EGFR
description: Epidermal growth factor receptor, a receptor tyrosine kinase.
fact: EGFR mutations or amplifications are found in several cancers and are drug targets.

name: APOE
description: Apolipoprotein E, involved in lipid metabolism and neuronal repair.
fact: The APOE Îµ4 allele is associated with higher risk of Alzheimer's disease.

name: CFTR
description: Cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator, an ion channel.
fact: Mutations in CFTR cause cystic fibrosis.
